info.name: BingMapsAPI - TechInnov
info.description:
Basic usage of REST services for Bing Maps API

TI team initiative for basic research of emerging technologies 2022

Deployed to an Apigee server

**Resource URL:** [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/getting-started-with-the-bing-maps-rest-services](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/getting-started-with-the-bing-maps-rest-services)

item.name: Traffic

query.description:
A bounding box defines an area by specifying SouthLatitude, WestLongitude, NorthLatitude, and EastLongitude values REQUIRED

Reference URL: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/common-parameters-and-types/location-and-area-types

include traffic location codes in the response OPTIONAL

Possible values: true or false

Specifies severity level of traffic incidents to return. OPTIONAL

Severity level of traffic incidents - 1: LowImpact, 2: Minor, 3: Moderate, 4: Serious

Specifies the type of traffic incidents to return.. OPTIONAL

Type of traffic incidents - 1: Accident, 2: Congestion, 3: DisabledVehicle, 4: MassTransit, 5: Miscellaneous, 6: OtherNews, 7: PlannedEvent, 8: RoadHazard, 9: Construction, 10: Alert, 11: Weather

request.description: Information about traffic incidents and issues.

response.name: /traffic - Get Traffic Incidents (SUCCESS)

query.description:
A bounding box defines an area by specifying SouthLatitude, WestLongitude, NorthLatitude, and EastLongitude values REQUIRED
Reference URL: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/common-parameters-and-types/location-and-area-types

include traffic location codes in the response OPTIONAL
Possible values: true or false

Specifies severity level of traffic incidents to return. OPTIONAL
Severity level of traffic incidents - 1: LowImpact, 2: Minor, 3: Moderate, 4: Serious

Specifies the type of traffic incidents to return.. OPTIONAL
Type of traffic incidents - 1: Accident, 2: Congestion, 3: DisabledVehicle, 4: MassTransit, 5: Miscellaneous, 6: OtherNews, 7: PlannedEvent, 8: RoadHazard, 9: Construction, 10: Alert, 11: Weather

header.value: origin, x-requested-with, accept, content-type, authorization, x-custom-header

response.body:
{
    "status": 200,
    "title": "OK",
    "details": "Search Successful!",
    "message": "1 results found",
    "count": 1,
    "data": [
        {
            "__type": "TrafficIncident:http://schemas.microsoft.com/search/local/ws/rest/v1",
            "point": {
                "type": "Point",
                "coordinates": [
                    14.435998,
                    121.006362
                ]
            },
            "description": "Roadwork on Marcos Alvarez Avenue from Alabang-Zapote Road to Jarn Road.",
            "end": "/Date(1664254983614)/",
            "icon": 3,
            "incidentId": 93635240628013000,
            "isEndTimeBackfilled": true,
            "lastModified": "/Date(1664247783614)/",
            "roadClosed": false,
            "severity": 2,
            "source": 5,
            "start": "/Date(1664205660000)/",
            "title": "Marcos Alvarez Avenue",
            "toPoint": {
                "type": "Point",
                "coordinates": [
                    14.43522,
                    121.005931
                ]
            },
            "type": 9,
            "verified": true
        }
    ]
}

item.description:
StartFragment

Use the Traffic API to get information about traffic incidents and issues, such as construction sites and traffic congestion.

EndFragme

**Reference URL:** [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/traffic/get-traffic-incidents](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/traffic/get-traffic-incidents)

item.name: Location

query.description:
Search mode for API
request REQUIRED
Search query REQUIRED
include neighborhood info: 1 (true) or 0 (default) OPTIONAL

maximum number of locations to return OPTIONAL

A string that contains an integer between 1 and 20. The default value is 5.

Specifies to include additional information in the response.

- queryParse: Specifies that the response shows how the query string was parsed into address values, such as addressLine, locality, adminDistrict, and postalCode.
- ciso2: Specifies to include the two-letter ISO country code.

If you specify more than one include value, separate the values with a comma.

Possible values: queryParse, ciso2 OPTIONAL

response.name: /location - Find Location by Query (SUCCESS)

Specifies to include additional information in the response.
- queryParse: Specifies that the response shows how the query string was parsed into address values, such as addressLine, locality, adminDistrict, and postalCode.
- ciso2: Specifies to include the two-letter ISO country code.
If you specify more than one include value, separate the values with a comma.
Possible values: queryParse, ciso2 OPTIONAL

header.value: origin, x-requested-with, accept, content-type, authorization, x-custom-header

query.description:
Search mode for API
request REQUIRED
The coordinates of the location for which you want the entities situated at that location. REQUIRED
include neighborhood info: 1 (true) or 0 (default) OPTIONAL

maximum number of locations to return OPTIONAL
A string that contains an integer between 1 and 20. The default value is 5.

Specifies to include additional information in the response OPTIONAL

- ciso2: Specifies to include the two-letter ISO country code.
If you specify more than one include value, separate the values with a comma.

Possible value: ciso2

abbreviated or expanded form of names OPTIONAL
- If false: "admin1" & country names will be in their official form (e.g.: “WA” for Washington state in USA and full name, e.g. "Occitanie" in France).
-If true: "admin1" names will be in expanded form (e.g. Washington), and "countryRegion" field with full name is added to address.

Specifies the entity types returned in the response.  OPTIONAL
Possible values: includeEntityTypes: businessAndPOI, address, naturalPOI
Reference URL: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/common-parameters-and-types/location-and-recognition-entity-types

response.name: /location - Find Location by Point (SUCCESS)

query.description:
Search mode for API
request REQUIRED
The coordinates of the location for which you want the entities situated at that location. REQUIRED
include neighborhood info: 1 (true) or 0 (default) OPTIONAL

maximum number of locations to return OPTIONAL
A string that contains an integer between 1 and 20. The default value is 5.

Specifies to include additional information in the response OPTIONAL
- ciso2: Specifies to include the two-letter ISO country code.
If you specify more than one include value, separate the values with a comma.
Possible value: ciso2

abbreviated or expanded form of names OPTIONAL
- If false: "admin1" & country names will be in their official form (e.g.: “WA” for Washington state in USA and full name, e.g. "Occitanie" in France).
-If true: "admin1" names will be in expanded form (e.g. Washington), and "countryRegion" field with full name is added to address.

Specifies the entity types returned in the response.  OPTIONAL
Possible values: includeEntityTypes: businessAndPOI, address, naturalPOI
Reference URL: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/common-parameters-and-types/location-and-recognition-entity-types

header.value: origin, x-requested-with, accept, content-type, authorization, x-custom-header

query.description:
Search mode for API
request REQUIRED
The coordinates of the location for which you want the entities situated at that location. REQUIRED

abbreviated or expanded form of names OPTIONAL

- If false: "admin1" & country names will be in their official form (e.g.: “WA” for Washington state in USA and full name, e.g. "Occitanie" in France).

-If true: "admin1" names will be in expanded form (e.g. Washington), and "countryRegion" field with full name is added to address.

Search radius in kilometers (KM). OPTIONAL

Only those entities that fall within this search circle are returned.

Default search radius is 0.25 KM. The maximum supported radius is 2 KM.

The maximum number of entities returned. OPTIONAL

Default value is 10. The maximum value is 20.

Unit for the radius parameter OPTIONAL

distance unit: kilometer, km, mile, mi

Specifies the entity types returned in the response.  OPTIONAL

Possible values: includeEntityTypes: businessAndPOI, address, naturalPOI

Reference URL: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/common-parameters-and-types/location-and-recognition-entity-types

response.name: /location - Location Recognition (SUCCESS)

query.description:
Search mode for API
request REQUIRED
The coordinates of the location for which you want the entities situated at that location. REQUIRED

abbreviated or expanded form of names OPTIONAL
- If false: "admin1" & country names will be in their official form (e.g.: “WA” for Washington state in USA and full name, e.g. "Occitanie" in France).
-If true: "admin1" names will be in expanded form (e.g. Washington), and "countryRegion" field with full name is added to address.

Search radius in kilometers (KM). OPTIONAL
Only those entities that fall within this search circle are returned.
Default search radius is 0.25 KM. The maximum supported radius is 2 KM.

The maximum number of entities returned. OPTIONAL
Default value is 10. The maximum value is 20.

Unit for the radius parameter OPTIONAL
distance unit: kilometer, km, mile, mi

Specifies the entity types returned in the response.  OPTIONAL
Possible values: includeEntityTypes: businessAndPOI, address, naturalPOI
Reference URL: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/common-parameters-and-types/location-and-recognition-entity-types

item.description:
StartFragment

Use the Locations API to get location information.

EndFragment

  
**Reference URL:** [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/locations/](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/locations/)

item.name: Routes

query.description: Key mode for API request REQUIRED

The mode of travel for the
route OPTIONAL

Possible Values:
driving (default), walking, transit

Specifies what parameters
to use to optimize the route OPTIONAL

Possible values:
time (default), distance, timeWithTraffic, timeAvoidClosure

Specifies two or more locations that define the route and that are in sequential order. You can have a maximum of 25 waypoints. REQUIRED 
Examples:
- waypoint.1=47.610,-122.107 [Point]
- wp.1=Seattle,WA [landmark]
- wp.1=Seattle,WA;66;SEA [icon and label]
- waypoint.1=1%20Microsoft%20Way%20Redmond,%20WA [address]

Specifies whether the response include information about itinerary groups (continuous itinerary items in same mode are usually grouped together). OPTIONAL
Possible values: true or false

Specifies the road types to minimize or avoid when a route is created for the driving travel mode. OPTIONAL
If no values are specified, highways and tolls are allowed in the route.
- highways: Avoids the use of highways in the route.
- tolls: Avoids the use of toll roads in the route.
- ferry: Avoids the use of ferries in the route.
- minimizeHighways: Minimizes (tries to avoid) the use of highways in the route.
- minimizeTolls: Minimizes (tries to avoid) the use of toll roads in the route. Note: If you specify more than one option for a road type, then the most restrictive option is used. For example, if you set the avoid parameter to both highways and minimizeHighways, the highways option is used and all highways are avoided.
- borderCrossing: Avoids crossing country borders in the route.
Examples:
avoid=highways
avoid=highways,tolls
avoid=borderCrossing

The units to use for distances in the response. OPTIONAL:
• mile or mi
• kilometer or km [default]

response.name: /routes - Calculate by Routes (SUCCESS - walking)

query.description: Key mode for API request REQUIRED

The mode of travel for the
route OPTIONAL
Possible Values:
driving (default), walking, transit

Specifies what parameters
to use to optimize the route OPTIONAL
Possible values:
time (default), distance, timeWithTraffic, timeAvoidClosure

Specifies two or more locations that define the route and that are in sequential order. You can have a maximum of 25 waypoints. REQUIRED 
Examples:
- waypoint.1=47.610,-122.107 [Point]
- wp.1=Seattle,WA [landmark]
- wp.1=Seattle,WA;66;SEA [icon and label]
- waypoint.1=1%20Microsoft%20Way%20Redmond,%20WA [address]

Specifies whether the response include information about itinerary groups (continuous itinerary items in same mode are usually grouped together). OPTIONAL

Possible values: true or false

Specifies the road types to minimize or avoid when a route is created for the driving travel mode. OPTIONAL

If no values are specified, highways and tolls are allowed in the route.

- highways: Avoids the use of highways in the route.
- tolls: Avoids the use of toll roads in the route.
- ferry: Avoids the use of ferries in the route.
- minimizeHighways: Minimizes (tries to avoid) the use of highways in the route.
- minimizeTolls: Minimizes (tries to avoid) the use of toll roads in the route. Note: If you specify more than one option for a road type, then the most restrictive option is used. For example, if you set the avoid parameter to both highways and minimizeHighways, the highways option is used and all highways are avoided.
- borderCrossing: Avoids crossing country borders in the route.

Examples:

avoid=highways

avoid=highways,tolls

avoid=borderCrossing

The units to use for distances in the response. OPTIONAL:
• mile or mi
• kilometer or km [default]

header.value: origin, x-requested-with, accept, content-type, authorization, x-custom-header

query.description: Key mode for API request REQUIRED

The mode of travel for the
route OPTIONAL
Possible Values:
driving (default), walking, transit

item.description:
StartFragment

Use the Routes API to create a route that includes two or more locations and to create routes from major roads. You can create driving or walking routes.

EndFragment

**Reference URL:** [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/routes/](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/routes/)

item.name: Imagery

query.description:
Key mode for
API request
Push Pins - Create push pins to pin point locations on a map image. Format: <lat><long>;;<pin label> REQUIRED
Map image size. Format: <width>,<height>
A display layer that renders on top of the imagery set. Possible values: Basemap,Buildings, OrdnanceSurvey, TrafficFlow. OPTIONAL
The level of zoom to display. An integer between 0 and 20. OPTIONAL
Specifies whether to return metadata for the static map instead of the image.
Specifies whether to change the display of overlapping pushpins so that they display separately on a map. OPTIONAL

Key mode for
API request REQUIRED
Push Pins - Create push pins to pin point locations on a map image. Format: <lat><long>;;<pin label> REQUIRED
Map image size. Format: <width>,<height>
A display layer that renders on top of the imagery set. Possible values: Basemap,Buildings, OrdnanceSurvey, TrafficFlow. OPTIONAL
The level of zoom to display. An integer between 0 and 20. OPTIONAL
Specifies whether to return metadata for the static map instead of the image.
Specifies whether to change the display of overlapping pushpins so that they display separately on a map. OPTIONAL

item.description:
StartFragment

Use the Imagery API to get static maps and Bing™ Maps imagery information.

EndFragment

**Reference URL:** [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/imagery/](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/rest-services/imagery/)
